title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: and rough Kirk Brae at a break-neck pace ; while Juden totally unable to comprehend what had taken place in front, partly drew up as the female rolled by the way-side, near the gate of the place ofBruntisfield.

title: More Bits from Blinkbonny. ... Second edition
author: Strathesk, John
snippet: The rays of the setting sun were tinging withgolden hue the bright green of the fresh foliage;the clear stream of the Blinkie Burn, as it creptdown by the Annie Green, sparkled or shimmeredbetween its banks, where the hawthorn was hoarywith blossom, and the leaves of the poplar, alder,and birch trees flickered from glowing green to downywhiteness. The burn was lost to sight as it creptround the Kirk Brae, where the windows of thechurch aud manse glimmered as if they had beenon fire; but it reappeared on the south side, emergingapparently out of a wooded ravine, crept round theback of the village in many a winding stream, andonwards through Strathbonny, until it joined theriver which flowed through the strath.
